name: K2-19
scenarioDescription:
The K2-19 Exoplanetary System

K2-19 is a star with 0.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.86 times its radius. It is located 952.83 light years away from the solar system.

K2-19 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-19 d

K2-19 d was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.51 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-19.

The mass of K2-19 d is 1.33 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-19 d is 1.14 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, K2-19 d is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

K2-19 b

K2-19 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2015-08. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.92 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-19.

The mass of K2-19 b is 130.89 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-19 b is 7.74 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-19 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

K2-19 c

K2-19 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2015-08. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.91 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-19.

The mass of K2-19 c is 42.87 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-19 c is 4.86 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-19 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-19, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by K2.
